lines: Mary Jane Jones is one of those friends who really knows how to be "one of the guys." She's been a good friend of yours since third grade. You would like to ask her to the school dance except for one problem: She is six inches taller
Against your better judgment, you ask her to the dance. She is extremely flattered. How does this make you feel?
You realize that friendship is much more important than having people point at you and laugh (which they do). The two of you have a terrific time together.

You worry about how you look so much that you wind up having a lousy time at the dance. You bring Mary Jane home early and decide not to go on any more dates until you grow. Too bad, she really is a nice person. How do you feel
Then stop being so concerned about what people think of you and have a good time!
Five years from now Mary Jane becomes a three million dollar-a-year fashion model, and you grow seven inches. The next time you ask her for a date, be prepared to be rejected!

You know, she was really hoping that you would take her. She wouldn't have gone with anyone else. The day after the dance you walk over to her in the hall. When you say hello, you notice a tear sliding down the side of her face. She
says that nothing's bothering her but you know exactly why she's upset. Do you feel:

Of course, you have a fantastic time. You make fun of everyone who is stupid enough to comment on the difference in your size. Five years after the dance, Mary Jane becomes a three million dollar-a-year model.
